trans-unit.source: Evaluate
trans-unit.target: Evaluate

trans-unit.source: Machine Learning / Evaluate
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning / Evaluate

trans-unit.source: Metrics Used for Model Evaluation
trans-unit.target: Metrics Used for Model Evaluation

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning calculates a variety of widely used metrics to help you assess the fit and accuracy of your model on a particular set of data.
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning calculates a variety of widely used metrics to help you assess the fit and accuracy of your model on a particular set of data.

trans-unit.source: For guidance on how to evaluate a model and interpret the values that are returned for each measure, see this article: <externalLink><linkText>How to evaluate model performance in Azure Machine Learning</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/machine-learning-evaluate-model-performance</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For guidance on how to evaluate a model and interpret the values that are returned for each measure, see this article: <externalLink><linkText>How to evaluate model performance in Azure Machine Learning</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/machine-learning-evaluate-model-performance</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Metrics for Classification Models
trans-unit.target: Metrics for Classification Models

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Accuracy</embeddedLabel> As a measure of binary classification, accuracy is the proportion of true results to total cases.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Accuracy</embeddedLabel> As a measure of binary classification, accuracy is the proportion of true results to total cases.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Recall</embeddedLabel> Defines the fraction of all correct results returned by the model
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Recall</embeddedLabel> Defines the fraction of all correct results returned by the model

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Precision</embeddedLabel> As a measure of binary classification, precision is defined as the proportion of true over all positive results.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Precision</embeddedLabel> As a measure of binary classification, precision is defined as the proportion of true over all positive results.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>F-Score</embeddedLabel> A measure of accuracy that balances precision and recall.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>F-Score</embeddedLabel> A measure of accuracy that balances precision and recall.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>AUC</embeddedLabel> Measures the area under the curve plotted with true positives on the y axis and false positives on the x axis.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>AUC</embeddedLabel> Measures the area under the curve plotted with true positives on the y axis and false positives on the x axis.

trans-unit.source: AUC is useful as a measure because it provides a single number that lets you compare models of different types.
trans-unit.target: AUC is useful as a measure because it provides a single number that lets you compare models of different types.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Average Log Loss</embeddedLabel> Measures the difference between two probability distributions – the true one, and the one in the model.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Average Log Loss</embeddedLabel> Measures the difference between two probability distributions – the true one, and the one in the model.

trans-unit.source: You can view the score as a measure of the penalty for wrong results.
trans-unit.target: You can view the score as a measure of the penalty for wrong results.

trans-unit.source: The log loss metric is calculated as follows:
trans-unit.target: The log loss metric is calculated as follows:

trans-unit.source: <math>P</math> is the returned by the classifier if the instance belongs to class 1, and 1 minus the probability if the instance belongs to class 0.
trans-unit.target: <math>P</math> is the returned by the classifier if the instance belongs to class 1, and 1 minus the probability if the instance belongs to class 0.

trans-unit.source: For multiclass models, the probability for each class is used.
trans-unit.target: For multiclass models, the probability for each class is used.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Training Log Loss</embeddedLabel> Also known as log loss reduction, or relative log loss.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Training Log Loss</embeddedLabel> Also known as log loss reduction, or relative log loss.

trans-unit.source: This metric can be interpreted as the advantage of the classifier over a random prediction.
trans-unit.target: This metric can be interpreted as the advantage of the classifier over a random prediction.

trans-unit.source: That is, a training log loss score of 20 can be interpreted as “the probability of a correct prediction is 20% better than random guessing.”
trans-unit.target: That is, a training log loss score of 20 can be interpreted as “the probability of a correct prediction is 20% better than random guessing.”

trans-unit.source: Metrics for Regression Models
trans-unit.target: Metrics for Regression Models

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Mean absolute error (MAE)</embeddedLabel> Averages all the error in the model, where error means the distance of the predicted value from the true value.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Mean absolute error (MAE)</embeddedLabel> Averages all the error in the model, where error means the distance of the predicted value from the true value.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Root mean squared error (RMSE)</embeddedLabel> Measures the average of the squares of the errors, and then takes the root of that value.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Root mean squared error (RMSE)</embeddedLabel> Measures the average of the squares of the errors, and then takes the root of that value.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Relative absolute error (RAE)</embeddedLabel> Whereas absolute error measures how far the prediction is from the truth in absolute values, RAE represents the error as a percentage of the true value.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Relative absolute error (RAE)</embeddedLabel> Whereas absolute error measures how far the prediction is from the truth in absolute values, RAE represents the error as a percentage of the true value.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Relative squared error (RSE)</embeddedLabel> Takes the total squared error and normalizes it by dividing by the total squared error of the predicted values.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Relative squared error (RSE)</embeddedLabel> Takes the total squared error and normalizes it by dividing by the total squared error of the predicted values.

trans-unit.source: Resources
trans-unit.target: Resources

trans-unit.source: Interpreting the results of evaluation of machine learning models is an art, one that requires understanding the mathematical results as well as the data and the business problems.
trans-unit.target: Interpreting the results of evaluation of machine learning models is an art, one that requires understanding the mathematical results as well as the data and the business problems.

trans-unit.source: See these articles for an explanation of how to interpret results in different scenarios:
trans-unit.target: See these articles for an explanation of how to interpret results in different scenarios:

trans-unit.source: How to choose parameters to optimize your algorithms in Azure Machine Learning
trans-unit.target: How to choose parameters to optimize your algorithms in Azure Machine Learning

trans-unit.source: How to interpret model results in Azure Machine Learning
trans-unit.target: How to interpret model results in Azure Machine Learning

trans-unit.source: How to evaluate model performance in Azure Machine Learning
trans-unit.target: How to evaluate model performance in Azure Machine Learning

trans-unit.source: Module
trans-unit.target: Module

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Cross validates parameter estimates for classification or regression models by partitioned the data
trans-unit.target: Cross validates parameter estimates for classification or regression models by partitioned the data

trans-unit.source: Evaluates a scored classification or regression model with standard metrics
trans-unit.target: Evaluates a scored classification or regression model with standard metrics

trans-unit.source: Evaluates the accuracy of recommender model predictions
trans-unit.target: Evaluates the accuracy of recommender model predictions
